00019 MoveableCamera::MoveableCamera(): Camera() {
00020 
00021     position_ = Vector3d();
00022 
00023     view_ = Vector3d();
00024 
00025     up_vector_   = Vector3d();
00026 
00027 
00028     view_(0) = 0.0;
00029     view_(1) = 1.0;
00030     view_(2) = 0.5;
00031 
00032     up_vector_(1) = 1.0;
00033 
00034 }

00038 void MoveableCamera::set_view_by_mouse(int x, int y) {
00039 
00040 
00041     int middle_x = screen_width_  >> 1;
00042 
00043     int middle_y = screen_height_ >> 1;
00044 
00045     float angle_y = 0.0f;                           // This is the direction for looking up or down
00046 
00047     float angle_z = 0.0f;                           // This will be the value we need to rotate around the Y axis (Left and Right)
00048 
00049     static float current_rot_x = 0.0f;
00050 
00051 
00052 
00053 
00054 
00055     // If our cursor is still in the middle, we never moved... so don't update the screen
00056 
00057     if( (x == middle_x) && (y == middle_y) ) return;
00058 
00059 
00060 
00061     // Set the mouse position to the middle of our window
00062 
00063     glutWarpPointer(middle_x, middle_y);
00064 
00065 
00066 
00067     // Get the direction the mouse moved in, but bring the number down to a reasonable amount
00068 
00069     angle_y = (float)( (middle_x - x ) ) / 1000.0f;
00070 
00071     angle_z = (float)( (middle_y - y ) ) / 1000.0f;
00072 
00073 
00074 
00075     // Here we keep track of the current rotation (for up and down) so that
00076 
00077     // we can restrict the camera from doing a full 360 loop.
00078 
00079     current_rot_x -= angle_z;
00080 
00081 
00082 
00083     // If the current rotation (in radians) is greater than 1.0, we want to cap it.
00084 
00085     if(current_rot_x > 1.0f){
00086 
00087         current_rot_x = 1.0f;
00088 
00089     // Check if the rotation is below -1.0, if so we want to make sure it doesn't continue
00090 
00091     } else if(current_rot_x < -1.0f) {
00092 
00093         current_rot_x = -1.0f;
00094 
00095     // Otherwise, we can rotate the view around our position
00096 
00097     } else {
00098 
00099         // To find the axis we need to rotate around for up and down
00100 
00101         // movements, we need to get a perpendicular vector from the
00102 
00103         // camera's view vector and up vector.  This will be the axis.
00104 
00105         Vector3d axis = Cross(view_ - position_, up_vector_);
00106 
00107         axis = Normalize(axis);
00108 
00109 
00110 
00111         // Rotate around our perpendicular axis and along the y-axis
00112 
00113         rotate_view(angle_z, axis);
00114         Vector3d y_axis = Vector3d();
00115         y_axis(1) = 1.0;
00116 
00117         rotate_view(angle_y, y_axis);
00118 
00119     }
00120 
00121 }

00130 void MoveableCamera::strafe_camera(float speed) {
00131 
00132 
00133 
00134     // Add the strafe vector to our position
00135 
00136     position_(0) += strafe_(0) * speed;
00137     //position_(1) += strafe_(1) * speed;
00138     position_(2) += strafe_(2) * speed;
00139 
00140 
00141 
00142     // Add the strafe vector to our view
00143 
00144     view_(0) += strafe_(0) * speed;
00145     //view_(1) += strafe_(1) * speed;
00146     view_(2) += strafe_(2) * speed;
00147 
00148 }
00149 
00150 
00151 
00152 
00153 void MoveableCamera::move_camera(float speed) {
00154 
00155     // Get the current view vector (the direction we are looking)
00156 
00157     Vector3d vector = view_ - position_;
00158 
00159     vector = Normalize(vector);
00160 
00161 
00162 
00163     position_(0) += vector(0) * speed;      // Add our acceleration to our position's X
00164     //position_(1) += vector(1) * speed;
00165     position_(2) += vector(2) * speed;      // Add our acceleration to our position's Z
00166 
00167     view_(0) += vector(0) * speed;          // Add our acceleration to our view's X
00168     //view_(1) += vector(1) * speed;
00169     view_(2) += vector(2) * speed;          // Add our acceleration to our view's Z
00170 
00171 }

00174 
00175 void MoveableCamera::move_forward(){
00176     move_camera(kSpeed);
00177 }
00178 
00179 void MoveableCamera::move_backward(){
00180     move_camera(-kSpeed);
00181 }
00182 
00183 void MoveableCamera::strafe_left(){
00184     strafe_camera(-kSpeed);
00185 }
00186 
00187 void MoveableCamera::strafe_right(){
00188     strafe_camera(kSpeed);
00189 }

00193 
00194 void MoveableCamera::update(const std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<WorldObject> > & marker,
00195                             const std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<Obstacle> >& obstacles,
00196                             const std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<RobotData> >& robot_data) {
00197 
00198 
00199 
00200     Vector3d cross = Cross(view_ - position_, up_vector_);
00201 
00202 
00203 
00204     // Normalize the strafe vector
00205 
00206     strafe_ = Normalize(cross);
00207 
00208 
00209 }

00213 void MoveableCamera::look() const{
00214 
00215     // Give openGL our camera position, then camera view, then camera up vector
00216 
00217     gluLookAt(position_(0), position_(1), position_(0),
00218               view_(0),  view_(1),     view_(2),
00219               up_vector_(0), up_vector_(1), up_vector_(2));
00220 
00221 }
